title: Cousins in Binary Tree
content:
In a binary tree, the root node is at depth 0, and children of each depth  node are at depth .
Two nodes of a binary tree are cousins if they have the same depth, but have different parents.
We are given the  of a binary tree with unique values, and the values  and  of two different nodes in the tree.
Return  if and only if the nodes corresponding to the values  and  are cousins.
 



 


The number of nodes in the tree will be between 2 and 100.
Each node has a unique integer value from 1 to 100.
